description: Natalia and Nea. Are always super helpful and awesome! The reason why I always find myself coming to this location. Thanks!
author: Paulo N.

description:
This is the filthiest Chipotle I have ever been to. I still remember when it opened up and it was in excellent condition. I was really surprised to come back and see the current state. There was trash on the floor and on the tables that wasn't removed even after 20 minutes. Someone wiped down one table top and then disappeared. The furniture looks stained and is torn with stuffing even coming out of some of the chairs. 

I ordered a bowl and quite a bit of the rice was stale/hard. The only reason it gets two stars is because the workers were friendly enough. 

This place needs a serious update and cleaning.
author: Salma R.

description:
Really really crappy Chipotle. I'm fairly confident that on the weekends they serve whatever ingredients are left from the week - everything is cold and stale. Workers are clueless and they seem to be hiring new people constantly, seems they cannot keep staff, so again they are clueless. Tiny portions, like ridiculously tiny. Around 50% of the time they are out of something with no explanation - taco shells, guacamole, chicken, etc.  Dirty floors and dirty counters. The Sprite tastes like weird funky water. 

Just a terrible chipotle, avoid if you can.
author: Darin M.

description:
By far the best Chipotle spot in SF. Why? Because it's huge so there's always a seat available. This location has 2 floors, and there's always a seat above. I always find it difficult to find a seat at other Chipotle's.

For some reason, the food tastes better and the service is faster on weekdays. On weekends, there's less customers but the line moves much slower and the quality diminishes.
author: Vicki L.

description:
One of the worst chipotles ever visited.  Didnt have fajita, rice was pretty nasty, chicken burned, floor terribly  dirty, there were some empty plates with some leftover food on the table(see pic).  Yet i ordered a chicken burrito and sat next to the pile of trash on the bench. Even though i was starving, i could only eat 60 percent of it coz their burrito  was tasteless, seriously tastless!! 
And...that was my very first visit here and unfortunately  it became my last too.
author: Tom K.

description:
Came in on National Avocado Day and was hoping they would honor the free guac since the online orders and app were not working. Unfortunately they did wouldn't budge.

Workers aren't particularly friendly and the guac did not taste fresh compared to other Chipotles I've been too. It was very stringy and salty. Very let down since I had to pay for the guac on National Avocado Day. 

The worst part was how they skimped on guac, meat and rice. I asked for a little more rice since I don't get beans and they said they would charge extra for it. 

The only good things I could say are that the steak was good and that the line wasn't too long.
author: Alex Y.

description:
Not sure why this has such low reviews on yelp.  It's a Chipotle, it can never be that bad!

I had a great experience.  Ordered a barbacoa burrito with guacamole and used a BOGO coupon.  Friendly staff, overall clean story with plenty of seating, just wish the line was a bit shorter.
author: Jade R.

description: Tiny portions and the employees have horrible attitudes. I've never been to a Chipotle this terrible and won't be returning.
author: Christine G.

description: This is the worst chipotle, ever. Why do you have so many employees and only one person working the line?! It's an assembly line for burritos -- this is why you will be replaced by robots.
author: Anthony K.

description: Why is this place so flippin' dirty? I was so grossed out by the dirty tables, chairs, floors, that I didn't want to order anything. Unfortunately we needed a small bite to hold us over until dinner so I had a taco. It had plastic bits in it so I couldn't finish it. Next time I'll let my stomach digest my organs before coming back here.
author: Susie K.

description:
Not sure why all the bad reviews. The food is about on par with other Chipotle chains and there are a lot of them in the city.  The dining areas are large - downstairs, upstairs.  Hubby was impressed with the walls upstairs, basically plywood on the walls and ceilings. I like the bathrooms upstairs, you need the code on the bottom of your receipt to get in.  And it was clean in there with 2 stalls for the women's room.  It's very airy and clean looking upstairs but I didn't like the rounded couches to sit on and preferred the 4 regular tables in the back. 

I ordered the chicken bowl, brown rice, added corn, tomatoes, cheese, sour cream, lettuce and $2.25 extra for the large spoonful of guacamole.  Should've skipped one of the dairy products and the guacamole as it was so big I could only eat about 1/2 of it.  Fortunately, Hubby ate his Carnitas bowl, sans cheese, dairy products and finished the rest of mine. The bowl was flavorful and very filling for me.
author: Ry T.

description:
Seems understaffed. Seating area dirty. Out of beans (both kinds), fajitas, and lemons. Frequented by panhandlers. 

Aside from all the above, still love Chipotle. This location is just particularly bad.
author: Brandon W.

description:
Got a weird half of an avocado that was too hard to even bite through in my guac... yikes. And I'm alnost sure it wasn't guac either, just avocado??? 
Not that it was as big of a deal, the pick up order wasn't quite done on time either. But it was a lunch rush so I get that part
author: Emilie F.

description: Staff is friendly and knowladgable but the food is disgusting not edible. This is not a type of food anyone should eat. Just disgusting there is no other word to explain this kind of food. This is actually not even food, it tastes like nothing proteins are chewy and super dry. You can slightly taste some cilantro but that is basically the only thing you are gonna taste other than that you are just chewing the air with some air sauce. Waste of resources of this beautiful world and eventhough it is cheap ($15 with drink and extra guac) it is totally waste of money. If you want to have a disgusting bowl of slurry and waste every penny that you paid for, you should definitely come here and enjoy the taste of waste.
author: Fikret D.

description: Went here earlier because it was a little closer than a different chipotle. There floor was disgusting, and there was trash on the ground. The girl working did a terrible job wrapping my burrito. They gave us stale chips and when we asked for different chips they gave us more stale chips and then just ended up giving us a refund which was nice of them. Not a really good experience though.
author: Meghan H.

description: If you like waiting in line to have workers not know anything about the cash register and then try to serve you a cold burrito after spending ten minutes on the previous customer, well then this is the chipotle for you!
author: Ryan D.

description:
Guaranteed to hit the lunch spot in this area!

I love their classic steak bowl salad!  Load it up with salsa and hot sauce!  Yum!

They have a contemporary upstairs dining!
author: Tiffany D.

description: I came here on my 30 min lunch. The girl behind the counter took 5 min to even greet. She looked as if she was lost, checking the food. A simple hi I'll be right with you would been nice. By the time I got my food I had 6 min to eat and 3 min to get back to work out of 30 min. I never have this issue in Pleasant Hill. Guess they are not all the same just the same name. This is the 2nd time as why I leave this review.
author: Aaron W.

description:
Although San Francisco is full of great Mexican restaurants around, chipotle stays a place that you always wanna come back to. Maybe it's the nostalgia to the college days or something. 

This location is great because it's close to Union Square and many find destinations downtown.
author: Ahmad A.

description:
Is it sacrilegious to leave a review on Yelp for a chain fast-food restaurant in a major city? Anyhow, I love Chipotle, but this location always gives less meat and less ingredients overall. Other locations, I'm stuffed. This place I'm always still hungry. I would say I get the normal amount of meat about 1 out of 5 times, but I still keep coming back for that 20% chance. Maybe this is the new norm, but I'm used to what other Chipotle's give. 

I gave an extra star, because today, an employee came around to ask how everything was, so I decided to tell him my meat disappointment. And, embarrassingly, my friend asked if we could get more meat -- and he actually brought it! So, plus one star for being receptive to the critique.
author: Kevin L.

description: You can't ever go wrong with Chipotle. However, this place is terrible! I went and it was extremely slow. While I was placing my order they were trying to fulfill a web order. They were clearly not paying attention because I had to ask for a bowl for one of the burritos they were making. At that point I should have just asked for a tortilla on the side and ordered a bowl! The cashier was extremely rude threw our food into the bag and even ripped the back because she was slamming everything inside. When we got back to our hotel one of the burritos was already outside of the aluminum! How is that even possible! If you are looking for a quick bite and something closing a tad bit later this is an okay place just because you can't ever go wrong with chipotle.
author: Elva N.

description: Who doesn't love Chipotle! The one on sutter is very modern chic! Double level building with seating up and downstairs. Large bay windows to see outside and of course great food!  Great place for lunch
author: Rhett B.

description: I ordered the salad chicken bowl. I was lucky to get my order fast because I know it will be busy during lunch time. The food was good but adding guacamole on the side was not worth since they will charge $2.45 for it.
author: Melinda B.

description: This Chipotle always has wildly variant service, I assume because they are often cycling in new employees for some reason.  Usually I suck it up because, in the aggregate, it's fine and the food is still Chipotle.  But today, I had to struggle to get the employee of the week to even give me normal portions.  Multiple times I had to ask her to add more of whatever the topping was -- the meat, the tomatoes, the corn -- for literally every topping.  A tablespoon of barbacoa is not worth having to pay for meat, especially given the increased prices that come with being in the financial district in San Francisco.
author: Andrew O.

description:
I didn't even get a chance to purchase anything from this location due to how terrible and rude the service was here. Chipotle has struggled with winning back customers after their whole e.coli scare and this location is definitely not helping chipotle gain (or keep) any customers. 

I stopped in here on a rainy weeknight - maybe around 6 or 7 and was instantly greeted by the staff with a "RESTROOMS ARE FOR CUSTOMERS ONLY!!" I had JUST walked in maybe 10 seconds prior so I'm not sure what prompted such a rude welcome. I turned right back around and decided that I'd rather brave the rainy weather to find a friendlier restaurant than deal with the attitude and rudeness here.
author: Johanna H.

description: This store is super slow I was picking up a catering order that nobody seemed to check on until I  got there I had to wait an hour for the order and some of the staff members seemed a little dazed and confused specially the blonde girl who refuse to do anything other then bag chips...... you need better management at this store the employees are slacking
author: Amber H.

description:
Worse Chipotle ever.  The staff was rude af, I had to repeat myself multiple times and they had the look of frustration and anger whenever I made any requests.  My meal was definitely rushed and the quality definitely suffered, it felt like I was squeezed through an assembly line.  

Also the brown rice was under cooked, it was somewhat crunchy. 

I will not be back here.
author: Henry L.

description: While I was eating my bowl today, I tasted something odd, I immediately spat it out on a napkin and find out that it was two finger nails. Super disgusted.
author: Francis C.

description: Thieves!! They always give half the actual quantity. Plus the taste sucks.. chipotle should work with this location and improve the quality...
author: Arjun K.

description: They close the upstairs and bathroom an hour early and tell me I can sit and eat in the waiting section. Seriously? Just lazy.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Nice, clean and spacious facility for a restaurant. The staff members are friendly and service was quick. Two thumbs way, way up for efficiency. I ordered the Bean and Cheese Burrito - one of my favorites arand it's delicious. There's a second floor seating area which is a good thing. I'm coming back for lunch next time.

There is a soda fountain station available, customers can fill their own drinks.
*Props to this amenity

Hours of operation:
Monday - Friday 11:00 am - 10:00 pm
Saturday - Sunday 11:00 am - 8:00 pm

The correct zip code is 94108
author: Bennett W.

description: Chipotle: you officially lost me as a customer.  I've patronized many restaurants in the last few moths.  Service across the board is sloppy.  Portions keep getting smaller. Skimping on meat and cheese and charging too much.  Always find a bunch of fatty meat in my food. So I'm paying for a premium ingredient and having to spit out 10%.   See ya chipotle
author: M A.

description: Maybe I'm used to Berkeley's big portions because I was really disappointed by my burrito bowl at this location. I had to ask for more lettuce because it looked more garnish than anything.
author: Jane H.

description:
I was expecting more from a location that is in fact "at the heart of downtown," as another reviewer put it. I arrived 40 minutes before closing on a weeknight, while working late.

1. No white rice.
2. No chicken.
3. No steak.
4. Nowhere to sit, because the upstairs was roped off.
5. A large group of people who wanted somewhere to sit with their food, trying to convince the staff to let them upstairs.

I can't imagine what the hell this store's manager is thinking. If you're going to stop preparing food and close down the dining room to clean it, that's when you should close the damned store.
author: Robin D.

description: Just got lunch and not only is my food ice cold, but I just paid $1.10 for a small bag of chips that contained literally 6 chips.  See picture
author: Claudia D.

description: I'm a big fan of Chipotle, decided to come to this location and had a terrible customer service experience. Employees didn't look happy at all and they served my meal like if they didn't want to do it. I understand is a fast pace place but the location wasn't even packed. I think this is something that needs to be addressed. Good food, clean location over all.
author: Joe W. O.

description:
Rude service, the food quality was not even close to the other chipotle locations. After we complained about the food, they just rolled they us at us , not even an apology.
I will never ever comeback to this place.
author: Boban V.

description:
Whenever I go to certain locations there seems to be a problem related to service. So I would like to review the one on Kearny where in particular I waited forever, was told I would receive extra guac without charge (which is how it should be anyway) since I waited so long, then was sent intentionally away (blown off) without extra guac at all after waiting even longer. I was quite patient and as more people came in it just seemed the period was extending, even though I walked in way sooner than they did. They were making more guac because it ran out, but it wasn't so busy before I came in and they hadn't replaced it. So, you can blow me off but not my fault you can't do your job right. Thanks little man. What as asshole. I give another location four stars.

Note This is a 'restaurateur' location. Which means it doesn't represent Chipotle as directly and is more individually owned, to my understanding. That's part of why it looks so different. I thought the seating/location was cool.
author: M R.

description:
Cheap, consistent, fast, and loud. 

I have been working in the financial district and told myself that I'm not going to eat Chipotle for my lunch break but the new intern from Sweden wanted to try Chipotle so since I'm nice I said sure. 

12pm - Long line. The line can be overwhelming but it moves fast. Hence, they just ask what you want, pay, and go. It can be really hard that you can't barely hear what the servers are asking you. 

I normally go to the Mission District if I crave for good tacos and burritos. I tend to stay away from Chipotle.
author: Jennifer B.

description: Wups, went to the wrong chipotle. This location has lackluster food and lackluster service... I suppose there are some really shitty Starbucks out there, so I shouldn't expect anything more from Chipotle - there's bound to be a bad egg somewhere in the bunch.
author: Ross R.

description:
What happened here

Date & Time: Wednesday @ 8:30PM
Parking: Easy Street Parking
Issue: Inventory - NO Chips, NO Hard Taco Shell, and no 7UP
Seating: Can't sit upstairs on 2nd level, but no sitting available on the 1st floor
author: Ryan R.

description:
TIP - If you're just getting chips and guac, you don't have to wait in line. Just go up to the cash register and order. 

The chips and guac were just the usual, but the one thing I really didn't like was that at this Chipotle, if you wanted to use the bathroom, you had to buy something first. The restrooms upstairs require a number code to unlock the doors, and the only way you can get the code is if you buy something because the code is at the bottom of your receipt.
author: Andrew T.

description:
This is just another typical Chipotle but except this one is not what I want in a chipotle.
This chipotle is usually crowded during office hours but the service is sometimes gets very moody.
By that I mean, I don't get a consistent amount on my bowl. I always take the burrito bowl and have always put the same ingredients but never got consistency. This totally depends on the mood of the person making it, if they are in a grumpy mood then expect your bowl to be half the normal size and if in a good mood then maybe a full bowl. To this I would say, it's always grumpy so I am left hungry after the bowl.
Increasing prices and diminishing brand image is not helping but it is only going to lose customers.
author: Shreyash S.

description: The food is pretty much true same at most locations. This one is extremely slow and the staff is inefficient and indifferent. When I say slow, I mean about 20 minutes to serve a line of 5 people.
author: Lan K.

description:
No offense, but to me all Chipotles are created equal. And by equal, that's mostly good for all of them because I do like Chipotle quite a bit. Generally fresh food, fast service, nice people. 

I will give extra kudo's to this location because I went in on Monday when they did the promotion - try the Sofritas and get a coupon for a free entree when you return within the next month. They ran out of Sofritas by the time I got there for dinner, but were still honoring the coupon for everyone. Cool guys! I respect that.

All I have to say is never get something without guacamole. I tried it once and it was the worst. Guacamole FTW.
author: MaryKate M.

description:
It's chipotle. It's a chain. All of their restaurants taste the same....hey that sorta rhymes bustah.

Seriously My office is really close and that is the reason I go...and it is "organic and sustainable".....but seriously folks????  Those lines out the door...not really anyplace to eat.

We live in a city of amazing taquerias owned by families and small businesses...can we show them some love????
author: David G.

description:
Typical Chipotle, however i never noticed how skimpy they are compared to other Chipotle's :\
Even when i order a veggie bowl it always comes out waaayyy overpriced which i don't understand why ( this is even w/o a drink!). 
Service is nothing special. All tastes the same but some days when i eat here i get the MOST HORRIBLE stomach pain :\ which has recently made me stop coming as much.
author: Xochitl T.

description: Chipotle already has a bad reputation for giving out meager portions.  I lived in Texas and Virginia for a time and it doesn't seem to matter which city or state you go to, portions are small.  In all of those states, including California, I have heard people say "Is that all I get?"  But this location takes the cake for the worst portion size, ordered the chicken bowl, 9 small morsels of chicken.  The server didn't even fill the spoon up.  When I got to the register and looked at the bowl, I could see tons of brown.....as in the cardboard bottom of the bowl.  I hate this place for that reason alone, but several times I have to come here out of convenience and timing. I think Chipotle will go under soon anyway and they probably need to save every cent.  Don't bother to ask or complain, been told at several locations (but this one in particular) that if you want even a nugget more, you have to pay.  In the end, you are at the mercy of the server for how much you get.  Luckily they have all be trained to give you nothing.  A friend of mine asked of we could have "a second dinner" after this, because it is never enough.  Seriously Chipotle sucks in generally, but this location is awful.  Large and spacious, yet more than skimpy.  If you watch when the staff eats, they get huge portions, for sure.  Someone needs to come up with a good rival to this place!
author: Nathan C.

description: Super busy, and smaller than average portions, but otherwise it's pretty much your average Chipotle. The staff was friendly enough despite being totally swamped. We needed something filling to eat on the go, and this suited our needs.
author: Maria E.

description:
TERRIBLE!

STAY AWAY!

I suffered horrible diarrhea because of this place. 
I hadn't been to a Chipotle in about a year, and this is what i get for coming back. 
I had the chicken bowl, and went home thinking I would be just fine.
Then, my stool started to turn into watery mush.
The next day, i awoke with pain in my belly area and feeling weak, tired, queasy stomach area.
I puked several times more and the uneasy feeling lasted for about 1 day and half. 
Luckily, my pains and cramps stopped and i am ok now.
author: Jim D.

description: The manager Jessica handles business like a pro! I had an an issue with cheese not being melted so I brought it back to get it heated. Jessica immediately took care of it and me with a smile and a handshake. I manage a store nearby and am thoroughly impressed  with her customer service.
author: Jason E.

description:
I'm a chipotle faithful so when I saw it was really near, I obviously came here for lunch. I got there around 1:30. Smallest scoops EVER!! And some of the employees were pretty rude. I understand you guys are busy but attitude is a little unnecessary. 
Other than that, the store is really nice. There are two stories and lots of clean places to sit.
author: Katrina M.

description:
I love Mexican & chipotle is my go to when traveling or looking for a beef salad or bowl. Today I was craving tacos. So after waiting a short time. The staff at this location was rude & very impatience. It's so sad to see Chipotle becoming a Mexican McDonalds! My taco fell apart in minutes of ordering. The corn shell tasted like cardboard. 

I ate in the restaurant. I'll add pictures. The staff doesn't care about you or your order. Just trying to get you out the door! So sad but luckily we live in SF there will be other options. Until they go back to what they were founded on. Freshness.
author: Kelly T.

description:
I was recently disappointed and frustrated with my experience at this Chipotle location. I went in on like a Tuesday night around 9pm and waited at least 10 minutes in line. I wanted something smaller, more of a snack, so I ordered the cheese enchilada and I added steak. The only cheese enchilada on their visible menu is the Kids Menu's cheese enchilada, and that's what I wanted/expected. 

Apparently there is an enchilada option for adults as well and that's what I ended up receiving. WARNING, THERE'S A HIDDEN MENU! At the register, I was charged for $8.32 as opposed to what I was expecting to be charged ~$5. 

It's not a huge price differential, but it's the principle and it's a confusing experience. Why should I expect and be charged for a normal-size enchilada when I don't see it as an option on the menu? I didn't think I'd need to specify the Kid's enchilada. Moreover, if I was going to pay $8+, I would have just gotten a damn burrito - better bang for my buck! 

Chipotle on Sutter, if you can take steps to prevent this confusion in the future that would be great and much appreciated!! 

I emailed Chipotle Customer Service and I was further disappointed that they wouldn't correct this experience for me with a refund/reimbursement/gift card, something! I got a sorry-not-sorry kindof response and I was just over it. 

Boo, I'm going to another location. Ain't nobody got time for inadequacy! 2 stars instead of 1 because I still love Chipotle food! Duh.
author: Monica B.

description:
I realize that it defies common sense to dine at Chipotle with all of the wonderful options for Mexican food in the city.  However, there aren't that many Mexican restaurants in the financial district, and certainly none as close to my office as Chipotle.  In addition, I think Chipotle's salad option provides a pretty healthy carb-free choice, and I have been trying to have one meal a day that does not contain carbs.  

A month or so ago, I decided to order a salad online from Chipotle for pickup -- ordering food ahead for pick-up and bypassing long lines is my favorite. I usually use the App "OrderAhead" to do that (LOVE) or Yelp's App (sometimes).  Since Chipotle is not offered on any Apps so far as I can tell, I ordered direct from the restaurant's website.  Seems simple enough.  Note that you have to order far in advance of the time you actually want to pick up your meal on Chipotle's website (and lunch is particularly busy, so order early).  At 3:00 p.m., I ordered a chicken salad with hot salsa, light black beans, cheese, no dressing, and guacamole on the side for pick-up at 5:20 p.m.

When I arrived at Chipotle at 5:25 p.m. (that's later than the time I scheduled for pick-up, by the way), I walked to the front to pick-up the order.  No one was in the pick-up window (there's a separate window to pick up online orders actually) and it took me a long time to be acknowledged by the cashier. This less-than-friendly young lady actually carded me for the salad, much to my surprise.  Does Chipotle get a lot of salad thieves?  Do I look the type that would steal a salad?  Am I on bath salts?  I was visibly irritated but I showed my ID and she went to retrieve the salad, which hadn't even been made yet.  The fact that it wasn't ready at the promised time really frosted my cupcakes -- it defeats the whole purpose of ordering online.  Don't offer such an option if you can't get it together to have the order ready by the time promised.  If I wanted to wait in line, I would not order online (that rhymed).

The cashier asked a young gentleman on the food line to make my order, which did not go well.  He accidentally put the guacamole on top of the salad instead of on-the-side, and when he realized he made a mistake, he took a plastic cup and proceeded to scoop the guacamole off of the top.  Oh, the horror.  First, you do not want guacamole on the top of the salad if you are watching your calorie intake.  Chipotle puts WAY too much and even though guacamole is good for you, it is still loaded with fattening, albeit delicious, calories.  Second, it was sort of gross to watch him scoop the guacamole with a plastic cup.  It seemed less than sanitary.  I think he should have simply made a new salad.  Given that he seemed a little green, and perhaps felt pressured during the dinner rush, I decided not to complain, although maybe I should have in retrospect.  After that incident, I simply decided I would not be back.  

And I wasn't.  Until this past Friday night, however, when I had just finished a long workout around 9:30 p.m. and was so hungry I could have eaten my own hand.  I didn't want to get anything too unhealthy, so I decided to get take-out from Chipotle against my better judgment.  The fact is, it's one of the only options in the area that late at night (which seems ridiculous by the way -- the area is loaded with hungry tourists and even hungrier young professionals, such as myself).  I waited patiently in a short line behind two tourists who had apparently never been to a Chipotle before -- they didn't "understand" what a salad was.  They were nice enough, but it took an inordinate amount of time for them to order two salads -- it's a salad choice guys, not a marriage proposal.  Finally I ordered a chicken salad, but was then informed that Chipotle had "run out" of guacamole.  ... ... ... How is that even possible!? It's like McDonald's running out of chicken mcnuggets -- it's simply not possible.  You can't run out of the one thing Chipotle manages to do correctly pretty consistently.  If I had known that walking in, I probably would have left.  The nice cashier assisting me asked if I wanted an extra serving of one of the other ingredients to make up for the missing guacamole, so I requested extra cheese, because duh, but I think I was charged for it.    

Ugh.  

In the future, if you have a Mexican food jones, I would take a little bit of extra time to walk across Market to Tropisueno (you can Order Ahead on the App and bypass the long lines) or even Unos Dos Tacos.  This Chipotle is not the best.  

You can't run out of guacamole when you serve (even quasi-) Mexican food.  It's just wrong.
author: Sunny S.

description:
I don't know what happens on weekends, but I've been here on three different days (two Sat, one Sun) and it's invariably S L O W P O K E C I T Y. 

Not just trainees on the line, which is inevitable, but employees huddling over some point of confusion or other. Three people in line, ten minutes to reach the register. I just wanted a burrito, not a formal Japanese Tea Ceremony. 

Maybe their all-star crew works weekday lunch.

One star service, bumped up a star because if you can stand there and wait the carnitas is good.
author: Derek S.

description:
1. The stupid girl that was doing the order, ignored us when we yelled "drain the beans" because who wants a wet burrito?
2. She put chicken, when it was steak
author: Riza P.

description:
I have never been to a Chipotle that gives so little. I went to this Chipotle because it was most convent. I clearly shouldn't of. Normally I'm a very big fan of Chipotle but not right at the moment. 

I'm giving out 2 stars because the food was fine, but the service was quite slow and the quantity  was close to none.  


"OH MY LORD
I WISH I COULD GIVE ZERO STARS 
THEY GAVE SO LITTLE OF EVERYTHING I MOSTLY SAW AIR
I EVEN SAID EXTRA
MAYBE I GOT EXTRA AIR
I GUESS EXTRA MEANS LESS
IT WAS LESS THAN LESS" my friends words to describe our time at this particular Chipotle.
author: Sarah T.

description:
Worst chipotle I have ever been to. Came in a couple months ago got a quesadilla with rice in it then I went in the next day and wanted the same thing but the manager wouldn't allow it even though I was willing to pay extra and was being so rude to me. 

Finally came back tonight at 9 after not being there for months and there was only one sweet guy making the food while there was a line of people waiting. The girl at the register wouldn't help and was too busy trying to close the store that should be open for another hour. The people in the back were laughing blasting music and not helping. The portions suck. I asked for lemon and they wouldn't cut a damn lemon for me because they were too busy trying to close an hour early. Worst chipotle ever and it's in the heart of the city. Something needs to change its a joke.
author: Maria A.

description: The people who work here look like they would rather be in prison. Also received raw chicken from here.
author: Jack L.

description: The staff is completely disrespectful. Not the entire staff specifically but one lady, with red hair. She was giving some customers a lot of attitude by giving them looks and rudely telling them their options. When most of the customers were gone, this lady started to mock the customers because they ask for extra food. This made me completely furious of how rude she was especially since there is still a couple customers remaining. When she said these remarks, we would obviously look over because of the attitude she's giving people. So she gives us a rude comment asking if we're waiting for someone and when we reply no, she tells one of her coworkers that we're always looking over. Well we wouldn't look over if she was being nice like a employee should be!
author: Carolyn H.

description:
Muy bueno.
A tasty veggie burrito, served quickly and with care. I was satisfied.
author: Corinne d.

description:
Got a giggle when I saw the price range on this yelp page, "$$$$", haha, someone must have had a bad experience.

But I have not! I know, it's Chipotle, a chain, a "sorry excuse for Mexican food" as some say, but I truly love it, and this location especially. The lunch rush can be brutal, but you can always order online first if you're in a hurry. I usually get a steak burrito bowl with pinto beans, and it's pretty much consistently good at each location I've been to. Fresh and hot, I always get extra red hot sauce and extra lettuce which is always crunchy.

My new thing, I have to tell you, is on a day when maybe I've brought a light lunch from home, want a super small lunch, or just feel like a snack, I got to Chipotle, and - people must hate me for this - get to cut everyone and just order chips and guacamole and red salsa (the combination of these is so satisfying and delicious). No waiting in line, it's like $3.59, and it makes me feel oh-so happy. The staff is very nice and get orders out the door fast! Also it's 2 stories which is just plain cool for a Chipotle in the FiDi.
author: Crystal C.

description:
Ate here about 1:20 pm on Sun/5 Jul:
- Standard Chipotle: good food, clean facilities.
- Line was kinda long but it went fast.
- Restroom upstairs requires punching in a 4 digit code to get in, the code is on the receipt.
author: Chan L.

description: This was first time I went back since the whole chipotle scare and man, am I disappointed.  Also, I used to frequent this chipotle years ago and it was waaay better than this. Tasteless dry chicken, unfresh pico de gallo, old rice...tasteless would have been the last word to describe chipotle years ago, but that is the only way I can describe my meal tonight. Please improve! I want my old chipotle back.
author: M C.

description:
The rare 2 story burrito place! This is in between FiDi, ChinaTown, French Bistros, Irish Bars, and Fancy shopping. The place is surrounded by glass and window seats, with an upstairs mezzanine. So you can watch people while you wolf down a 2 pound burrito, or they can watch you with hungry  eyes as they pass by. 

I go for the Fajita Barbacoa burrito. Instead of beans, grilled onions and bell peppers. This time they made a mistake and threw on black beans, and to make up for it, they added extra Barbacoa meat, to the point that they couldn't roll it into a burrito. It was a huge lump in my stomach after I downed that juicy mountain of Chipotle fixins covered-not-rolled by a tortilla. 

Good thing for you ladies wearing your 5 inch fashion pumps and sneaking a burrito, the wait line has a leather S curve seating, so you can sit and rest those barking dogs while waiting to order your main meat! (Or Sofritos, aka tofu). Just sit down ladylike because the seats are a little low, and if you were wearing a tube dress with those fashion pumps, it may become beaver season. BTW, why are you in a Chipotle if you are in high heels and a tube dress anyway? Saving money in case nobody buys you a drink at Ruby Skye? 

Why is Chipotle called Chipotle if they have no Chipotle sauce? 

On the positive side, they have probably single handedly taught gringos how not to pronounce it Chip-o-dole. Well, them and that old Taco Bell commercial that spelled it out. Sort of the same thing, don't you think?
author: Wanugee N.

description:
Owner of this place needs to hire a new manager. The staff is young so I can't really blame them. 
A girl asked a guy to make more rice. The guy popped his head out from the kitchen and said, " I'm on break for 4 more minutes.. Mind you it's a crowded restaurant at this point. Our order was a complete shit show. Bad management and lack of common sense.
author: Chris M.

description:
I'm a big fan of the Chipotle franchise normally, and often crave their menu. Last night however was an eye opening experience. 

After a late night Xmas party at my boyfriends company we decided to grab a late night snack at chipotle. When we ordered, we were helped by the least helpful person I've ever been in contact with. Upon asking for more white rice, the person in the picture BEHIND the Asian guy rudely commented that it was getting near closing time and we should just get chips and guacamole. Mind you this is 25 minutes before closing time!!!

When we protested, he told us it is chipotle policy to stop serving half an hour before closing time. This behavior is inexcusable. It was apparent he had somewhere to go after work and therefore in a hurry to leave. Is this how you treat customers? I'm very disappointed in the service at this location.
author: Kim K.

description:
I LOVE Chipotle. That's the only thing that makes this place 2 stars. Do not go to this location unless you really have to.
Sure it's one of the busier locations, but that's no excuse for the joke of a customer service they have. The general feeling is that they want to get you through the line and out of the door as soon as possible. I don't think anyone said one half-complete sentence to me throughout my time a the counter. They also give the tiniest portions of substance I've ever seen in any location; I ended up with more salsa than rice, beans and vegetables together on my burrito bowl, with spills on all edges of the bowl.
author: Judit H.

description:
Stopped by Chipotle on the way home from work - this was my very first time at any Chipotle ( again, proving I'm slow on the uptake )

Burrito w/ brown rice, black beans, cheese, corn, guac & salsa.  The burrito was completely loaded up w/ rice & corn but had minimal beans & even less present cheese or guac

There was also an overall smoky flavor to the burrito & guessing w/ a name like Chipotle, there would be an abundance of smoke which unfortunately for me is a showstopper - am NOT a fan of the smoke

Also extremely disappointed to find they charged for chips - so didn't get any

So sad to say that after all this time & w/ high expectations, didn't much care for my burrito & sad they charge extra for chips.  I've definitely had better burrito experiences
author: Adrienne G.

description:
Bad bad chipotle location. Not much right with this place. 

- Slow, rude and incompetent behind the counter
- Food quality not as good as other locations 
- Run out of certain items very early - steak, taco shells, guac. 

There are one or two nice employees who I'm sure are suffering because of the idiots. 

It's a chipotle. It goes by a formula. Have you people never been to another chipotle? The location on 4th and mission gets 5/5. Maybe go eat there sometime and take notes :)
author: Darin M.

description:
Warning: VERY skimpy on portions. My veggie bowl was all salsa - definitely under their correct standard portion size of rice, beans, fajitas, and guacamole. Other than that, the food itself was fine. Taste was consistent with the other Chipotles. Service was nothing of note. Would likely not be back if I didn't work nearby, and options weren't limited in this neighborhood.

Edit: I've really come to hate this location. It's 9:15, and they have the bathroom area blocked off with a very wet floor and a sign indicating the area is being cleaned. I worked at Chipotle way back in the day, and we NEVER cleaned the floors for the night while a customer was still in the store, let alone 45 minutes before closing. I was forced to eat my meal with unwashed hands coming off of work. Terrible. Chips not made well. And as skimpy as ever.

Edit 2: this place just gets worse! Last time at 7:30 pm they had the entire upstairs closed, meaning 80% of their seating and the restrooms off-limits (I got yelled at for trying to go upstairs to ask the gentleman cleaning to toss me some Chipotle Tabasco). People were sitting down to eat on the furniture that forms the line! These bathroom closures happen way too often at this location. Unacceptable, and disgusting! I also got really skimped on with beans (was given about 1/2 scoop - shocker, as this is the cheap 'filler' ingredient) and was almost shorted for the guacamole (the guy again attempted to give me 1/2 scoop) when I finally had to put my foot down. No way in HECK am I going to be charged $2 for 2 ounces of guacamole. I HATE this location and though I've been putting up with it since it's so close to my job, this might actually be the last straw. I'm either getting skimped on, they're out of taco shells or chips, or the bathroom is closed. No more.
author: Emily A.

description: Never thought I'd ever have to write a review for Chiptole, but some workers here are pretty damn rude. Came in asking for a steak quesadilla. The guys preparing my food was probably deaf af, and asked me "cheese quesadilla?" to which I replied several times "steak." He then threw my quesadilla into the heat press and walked away while I kept trying to get his attention. The cashier lady was nice enough to jump in with gloves and correct my order, and the guy helping me from before proceeded to talk shit about me, acting like it wasn't his fault lol. Talk about being both incompetent and (strangely) butthurt.
author: Tiffany Mae C.

description: Below average regular chipotle chain. Ask these guys for anything a little complicated and all thought goes through the window. I've been here plenty of times at different times throughout the day and it's just average if you don't care. One time I said no beans, the middle aged guy added beans. Tried to buy a bottle of apple juice another time, took the cashier like a full minute to get it even though the case was right behind her because even though I kept saying "APPLE juice" she kept trying to give me orange juice and whatever else was in there that looked nothing like apple juice. Several times. Today, I asked for my receipt. The cashier asked what kind of bowl I had and then gave me the wrong receipt anyway even though there were only 2 of them. Like I said, below average if you care since they apparently don't. ETA 9/13/18: was here today and the guy right before the cashier wrote in guac on my order even though I didn't order any just because the guy in front of me put guac on his order. I tried to get the guy to correct his mistake but the ****head just ignored me. Again--they don't care.
author: Ruth C.

description:
One of the worst chipotles I have visited. I have been to at least 15 different locations by now. 

Lettuce was stale, they skimp on the portions of everything, and the meat didn't have the same flavor as other locations.

I would avoid this particular location.
author: Mingmei N.

description:
I LOVE CHIPOTLE. Don't call me basic, Chipotle is basically my bae.

You really can't go wrong with Chipotle. Get a salad bowl, throw in some black or pinto beans, get half chicken half steak, throw in some salsa and pico, get that corn (extra corn please), skip the sour cream, dump a scoop of guac, and you're off to your merry way.

So why 3 stars for this Chipotle? With a small cup of guac for $2.33, and the workers giving you the tiniest scoops of meat - they're making me dislike Chipotle! And don't call in during lunch, you will have to wait forever!
author: Ting Jung L.

description: I went to this chipotle and food quality was good, I got exactly what I expected. What I didn't expect was how lovely Madison was and how excellent her customer service was. She was extremely helpful and made my day. I work in a client facing position and this girl is a gem her kindness, understanding and helpfulness surpassed anything I expected! Thank you so much Madison, chipotle you picked a great employee!
author: Noah L.

description:
Such a good Chipotle. The lines are ridiculous. This must be the most packed chipotle in the nation as it is in the heart of downtown San Francisco. That's the only bad thing I can say about this. The lines are quick and employees put together a hard nosed, hard working assembly line; not to mention they put together a mean burrito. 
Each employee knows how to provide a solid, well rounded scoop for your burrito or bowl, which is nice. 
Lastly, if you want a nice upper deck eating experience walk right up the stairs. They provide access to the soda machine on the top deck.
author: Matthew C.

description: My friend and I ate dinner here. Needed to use the restroom and were denied... Repeatedly. Cleaning is one thing but you can't just shut down the restroom indefinitely for the rest of the evening.
author: Brian Y.

description:
I don't know why this Chipotle started with just 4 stars!  I had an exceptional Chipotle experience today.

First off, what a sweet piece of real estate - right on the corner of Sutter, just a brisk walk away from Montgomery station and near a few fun shops .  With two floors - that's right TWO FLOORS (that's not easy to pull off for ANY San Francisco restaurant), it was nice to look over the hustle and bustle of downtown in the evening while enjoying my bomb Barbacoa AND chicken burrito (you know, I couldn't decide on just one).  

Second, they were jam packed for their first day today!  For a bright new staff, they kept their cool fairly well from what I saw.  Through the hundred of folks that may have passed by in the hour, they kept up a great air of customer service.  A little hectic and tad bit sloppy at some points, but give the staff some patience (I stress on patience seeing that the neighborhood is very excited to visit) and I'm sure they'll find their rhythm of greatness.

Third, it was just fun to be a part of a grand opening!  The air of excitement and loco-ness is enjoyable with the right company.  And, I do love me their fresh ingredients.
author: Nadia D.

description:
Sometimes I think to myself about how exactly does someone rate a fast food place, it's pretty much the same food everywhere.  I'm basically gonna skip over how I will always come back to Chipotle despite that it's not real Mexican food.  

So this location is like the laid back location closest to all your shopping needs compared to the one inside Westfield food court.  With two floors (more like one and a half), you get more seating without needing to sit shoulder touching shoulder.  Decently cleaned bathrooms, perhaps it's the lock effect.  Do keep your receipts because the bathroom code is printed on the bottom.  Food wise, it might depend on the person working that day, but my bowl had an odd proportion on the rice and the toppings. I had so little rice and so much sour cream, when everything was mixed in together, it wasn't the usual Chipotle taste that I'm used to. 

So why the four stars? Yea, it's a clean location. And I've experienced for the first time, good customer service at a fast food place. When we were finished with our food, and were too lazy to get up and clean up, one of the staffs came up to us, checked with us about the food, asked if we would like him to clean up the baskets/trays/trash, and wished us a good day.  This is the first time aside from the cashier to have a staff going above expectations at a fast food chain. I wish I know your name, but brown hair guy who checked with our needs, you go Glen Coco!
author: Connie C.

description:
I hate corporate food.  Chipotle is no difference.  The fact that you're in a line and other people are just throwing things together on a flap of tortia and calling it food is no excuse.

I still find myself hitting fast food joints out of necessities, but not this place.  Never again.
author: Mike S.

description:
Generally not the one to leave reviews, but this one calls for it. I have been to a lot of Chipotles in the nation, as it is my favorite place in the whole wide world (don't judge). However, in this one I was immediately greeted by the manager and several smiling coworkers. I'm also someone who doesn't normally like to talk to people when I'm out to eat/shop, but they made it very friendly and the conversation was "normal" instead of the regular dry-talk. 

As someone who had just moved to San Francisco (and by that I mean, pretty much that day), it was a very warm welcome. I even got a free burrito, which has never happened in NYC! As someone who also works in marketing for a living, and on top of that has put down enough money to put a kid through college by now, this is definitely how to win my business. Because of this wonderful experience and lovely gesture, I will not be going to any other Chipotle in the city from now on!

Thank you guys!!!
author: Kent V.

description: This branch of Chipotle is not a regular one. The quality is completely different. Everything tastes off. The staff is not attentive at all, yet it is very hard to communicate with then
author: Smith G.

description:
Tasty burritos, Nice staff and décor.
Good fast good at a good Price.
It seems to be a new location.
Monday night around 8, not crowded
author: Thierry B.

description: The food is good but the service is pretty terrible. The server is very rushy with your order. They're ALREADY asking if you want corn as they put the first grains of rice in your bowl. These people need to relax. I understand that you want to move the lines faster, but asking me if I want a bag to go as you're adding pinto beans doesn't help either of us.
author: George K.

description:
Chipotle was definitely on point today!

Location is very convenient as it is near Union Square (but I believe there is another one that is closer).  Customer service was friendly in the morning as we came from a 5K run and were absolutely starved.  

I ordered a salad with chicken, and it was completely satisfying.  But, the portions for chicken were really small.  Why do some chipotle's give way more meat than others?  That, I don't understand.

I really liked the interior design of this chipotle!  It is two stories, and the upstairs is very comfortable for big groups and eating.  A great design for what seems to be a small looking restaurant.
author: Jana L.

description: Went here last night with one of my co workers. I got the chicken burrito. The meat is tasty for being  a commercialized Mexican spot. It's just too bad they don't put much on there. We went in 15 minutes before closing. The women making the food rushed us. Hey we get it. You're trying to leave. I seen the small amount of chicken she was putting on my burrito and I asked for a bit more. She added another little chunk. Not sure if she owns some chipotle stock? It's 15 minutes till closing. You have a full container of chicken. I'm sure you guys make it up fresh every morning. I doubt you're going to pack away that container for the next day. I'm thinking whatever's leftover? Maybe the workers get to take home? Maybe that's why I paid $10 for a veggie burrito? This location kinda blew it. My co worker and I will not be returning to any chipotle. That first impression are the most lasting.
author: Jeremy T.

description:
The absolute worst customer service.
Especially the further up management I went trying to resolve the matter.
I feel so sorry for anyone who has to work under them. 
Chipotle could not care less about customers, clearly reflected by management.
Cheers.
author: Miss X.

description: I normally don't even write reviews for bad service but I literally got about 20 pieces of shredded lettuce and that was it......... I love chipotle but this store was just very very disappointing.
author: Kelly H.

description: Since my last review I did find myself enjoying their salad with black beans, sofrito, guacamole, salsa, and vinagrette. It's a fat bomb, but the ingredients are good. I hope they square away their issues with the food safety standards. This seems like a case of a place being singled out, but what do I know. It was surprising to see it nearly empty at 12 noon on Thursday. usually there are 90 people in line staring at their cell phones. My biggest concern with a place like this when they deal with huge profit hits after compliance problems is their longstanding employees. Many seem to have been there for years.
author: Roxmarie M.

description:
I like chipotle, but I'm giving up on this location. Every time I eat here my burrito is a disaster, and this time I was somehow charged extra when I asked the person assembling my burrito to be a little more generous with rice and beans. I was under the impression that they didn't charge for that. It's a veggie burrito...it's basically just rice and beans, I feel like it's fair for me to ask for more than a half scoop. Then plop goes the sour cream, all on one half of the burrito, "um...could I get more sour cream on the other side?" Plop goes a second scoop, in the same place. Now I have a lake of sour cream all on one end, a moat of Guac on the other, no man's land of nothing but rice in the middle. 

Happens almost every time at this particular location. 

Getting charged extra for an accidentally open-faced burrito with completely partitioned ingredients on a regular basis is going to make me avoid going to this location.
author: Colin M.

description: Chipotle is my go to place to get a chicken taco before my shift. Yushi is an awesome manager. Ray, Alana, Natalie and each person on that team has really made me feel like I'm a part of the family each time I go there. They know me by name and even have my order memorized. I go there almost every day and always leave happy and satisfied.
author: Joanna Y.

description: I used to enjoy Chipotle, but the quality has gone down the tubes. Ordered a burrito here recently, and the tortilla was tough and stale, and the rice was crunchy and undercooked. Too many better options in the city.
author: Eric T.

description: Great place to grab Mexican food (burritos and salad). This location is very spacious, with a second floor. Near BART, financial district and Union Square.
author: Ana C.

description: This is the WORST Chipotles I have EVER been in...and I usually eat at a Chipotles at least once a week.  They were out of a bunch of stuff and were in no rush to get more food out.  The manager didn't care and had MAJOR attitude.  It's also REALLY, REALLY DIRTY.  I will NEVER go back there again.  Thank goodness most other Chipotles are not like this one.
author: Shelley J.

description: Service was fast and friendly but steak burrito was bland and tasteless , tiny portions for price you pay and poorly rolled, burrito fell apart when you unwrapped the foil , more food ended up on table than in my mouth .... Pass!
author: Toby H.

description: These guys treat their regular customers real well. Appreciate the service & the speed with which they churn thru lunchtime lines.
author: Zach S.

description: Best Chipotle I been to so far, came in during my lunch break got great customer service and food. Melanie was awesome, she gave great service and she wasn't mad when I asked for extra rice and corn. I'm probably going to this spot again on my break tomorrow.
author: Wilson H.

description:
I like Chipotle in general, but felt inclined to write a review for this location because in my opinion, the customer experience here is not up to the chain's standards. The staff is disorganized, can't remember what I ask for from one second to the next, and the portions are really small compared to other locations. 
Plus, as others have mentioned, the design of the space, while attractive, makes it so loud that you practically have to shout while ordering. 
I've tried this location a few times in the hopes that the first few times were just "off" days, but the poor quality seems to be the norm at this location. Next time I'll go to one of the the (many) other Chipotle options downtown!
author: Ess V.

description:
Let me start with: I love Chipotle. I always get a steak burrrito bowl with a tortilla on the side. Its my go to for a quick lunch.

When this Chipotle first opened I ate there at least once a week for a month. I stopped and then one month later, I went back around 3pm. Everything tasted great like usual. Life was good. Umtil a couple hours later when I had THE WORST STOMACHACHE OF MY LIFE. I won't go into details but it turned out to be food poisoning and lasted for 2 more days. 

Ok so I thought it was a fluke, so of course I went back two weeks later. This time I went at the regular lunch time 1pm because maybe the meat was sitting out too long last time? Nope. Same thing. Not as severe but still bad. 

Then my coworker went against my warning. He said it was perfectly fine after he ate it and then the vommiting started a little later..
author: Angela T.

description: Just because it's busy doesn't mean I have to give you my order in two seconds. They slopped the food in, barely looking at me. I got half an order and after complaining to three people they flat out ignored me and just kept moving the machine along. Worst location. Terrible staff.
author: Julie H.

description:
Same menu and quality as other chipotles. However I definitely think it's better than the o'farrel one, which doesn't taste as fresh to me. I'm a big fan of the burrito bowls which save me some calories, but are still very filling. I usually get carnitas and steak. Today I tried the sofritas. I was expecting cubes of tofu, but it was actually strips. It was very flavorful, but overall I didn't enjoy it very much and it didn't seem very healthy due to all the seasoning. It's a great option for vegetarians but if you eat meat you probably won't prefer it to the other selections.

What's nice about this location is there's plenty of seating. There's 2 stories and there are a lot of stool seats for individuals as well as a few large tables for groups. It also has floor to ceiling windows which provides a lot of natural light and is great for people watching.
author: Alice J.

description:
Woohoo! This location is relatively new (opened earlier in 2013), but since it's in FiDi, it's PACKED during the lunch hours. They tried to create a line barrier with cushioned seats, but the line is still too long for it, haha. 

I love coming here for a quick bite to eat...I like their burrito/salad bowls. I like that they've added a new vegetarian item -- Sofritas! I find it a bit salty, but when it's paired with the lettuce, salsa, beans, and cheese, it's ok :) 

+Fresh ingredients
+Fast -- yep, they move fast here...there's just a ton of customers
+Friendly staff
+Clean and spacious -- the seats downstairs face the street and there's also an upstairs area
author: Katherine S.

description: This is probably the fastest Chipotle I've been to. Even during the times when the lines are almost out the door, the lines gets down pretty fast. Workers are friendly and super fast at prepping my food. One of my go to places for lunch!
author: Renee Y.

description:
My go-to spot for lunch in the financial district during work.

I LOVE Chipotle food in general so there's really nothing at ANY Chipotle that would make me write a SUPER bad review. 

The food here is consistent, although the portions are not. Some days, expect bigger portions than others, depending on who's working. 

Quick tip: ASK FOR MORE! You can ask for more rice, beans, fajitas, salsa, sour cream, cheese and lettuce all at NO EXTRA COST! The only extra cost would be extra meat and guacamole. 

I usually order the bowl here because you get the most bang for the buck since they can fit more food in the bowl. I would suggest it EVERYTIME. Even if you're craving a burrito, ask for the bowl and a tortilla so you can roll your own burrito (they suck at rolling them anyways). 

My usual: Burrito bowl w/ white rice, black beans, fajitas, DOUBLE chicken, mild salsa, sour cream, corn, and lettuce. 

This runs me about $9.41 and in the financial district, that's considered cheap for the amount of food you get.

Parking: Yeah right, it's the financial district. Take public transportation or pay crackhead price for parking. Chances are, if you're eating at this specific chipotle, you're already on public transportation.

Cash/Credit accepted.
author: Johnny G.

description: A-ok!  Fast and friendly service, clean, good location - can't ask for much more!
author: Maile N.

description:
I have been a Chipotle enthusiast ever since my first burrito back in high school. Back in the day I used to go on Chipotle runs with my friends after I already ate dinner, I was a little obsessed. Of the countless times I had Chipotle I have only been disappointed a small amount that can still be counted on one hand.

I stopped by after working a 11 hr day and I really need the comfort of a big warm Chipotle burrito. When you wait in line they provide seating, however the couches just confuse people. This guy just cut 3 people in line that were sitting (me included). I just shrugged it off because I don't want to be that person who calls out people for cutting.

I order my usual burrito: rice, black beans, fajitas, carnitas, tomatoes, corn and lettuce. They skimped on the rice, but I think they were trying to conserve a little until they got their next batch. After I paid for my burrito, the cashier pulled out a bag and was going to bag my burrito but then got asked a question. He just put down my burrito and the bag and stood there. Couldn't he have just put the burrito into the bag with the same motion? He just stood there for a good 45 seconds just talking, I guess he couldn't multi-task.

When I sat down and ate my burrito, it was just full of disappointment. Everything was bland and didn't taste as fresh as other locations. I'll probably still come back in the future since its open till 10 pm and is perfect for those late work nights. Hopefully it was just a fluke.

Note: Two stories! The second floor is a dining area.
author: David C.

description:
Man oh man oh man....oh man. What can I say about Chipotle, that Chipotle doesn't already exude. I'll go into a play-by-play so you Yelpers out there get that passionate, pristine, and accurate portrayal if what to expect. 

So it was a brisk morning. I'd say mid-to-low cold weather. Cold enough to not need a jacket but warm enough for dress clothes. I came in during rush lunch hour (12pm ish) and it was packed. The line did a loopty-loop several times looped over. I thought to myself, "wow, that's one long loopty-loop." But I was famished so I convinced myself to stay in line in order to devour their succulent steak. And man oh man oh man...oh man was the steak succulent, savory, and succulent. The line actually went at a decently mild pace, somewhat compared to the tortoise and the hare. So I galavant upstairs after I order my burrito, giddy like I have just seen the first snowfall of autumn. I rush to claim my throne on which I am about to devour this succulent steak (did I tell you how succulent their steak was?!). Low and behold, I ordered chicken by accident. It was aight. But yeah, I left disappointed in myself. I was going to go back and order some succulent steak, but the loopty-loop was too loopty. 

All in all and in conclusion, this place is dope. Chipotle is dope. If only they had a meat buffet. But that's for another day and another battle. Oh yeah, also when I left this fine establishment of burritos and meat, the weather cleared up and the sun was singing it's psalm of praise within the foggyness that is, Karl the fog. It The weather was now warm enough where you would double think of wearing a thin jacket, but yet cold enough to maybe a button up will suffice. 

I hope you Yelpers enjoy your burrito.
author: Andrew C.

description:
I love chipotle. I've been to tons just like everyone else on the planet. I've had a lot of bad experiences here that I haven't had elsewhere.

Sinks not working in the restrooms regularly. Employees on the burrito line are also stingy and just won't give you what you ask for. 

Go to the one on Ofarrell instead.
author: E J.

description: Chipotle continues to satisfy with consistency, my only gripe with them is their minuscule servings.  Pay for extra me is available, just unnecessary when you know how much food is wasted (thrown away) daily.
author: Dawud H.

description: I have been to this particular Chipotle twice, two annual conferences in a row. It's fairly fast, fairly inexpensive, fairly clean and predictable. It's also fairly crowded, fairly full of confused tourists (did the woman behind me really ask her husband "how does this work"), and fairly unhelpful (no they will not cut the burrito in half, but there's plastic knives over there). If I'm around next year, I might return. Or maybe I'll finally dive into something new - udon across the street perhaps, or cheesecake factory with a view. p.s. SECOND FLOOR?! OMG.
author: Dana G.

description:
I really do not like writing bad reviews, especially about restaurants because I work at one and I understand people have bad days, things go wrong and one grumpy customer can ruin even your WEEK!!! I don't want to be that person... but here goes:

However, today,  I had the single most unpleasant food experience I can remember.  It was about half an hour ago. I am FORCED to write this review just to make peace with myself.

I can list everything that went wrong, but I will not bore you with that.  The one single thing that I cannot shake from my head is this one girl's customer inservice. 

It was clear that she was semi-new because she did not know how to fold a burrito.  But you can't be mad at NEW, its sweet, cute, sometimes slow, but that's ok because it usually comes with humility, or timidness.  USUALLY.  Not this girl.

Brown Hair/Glasses.  She was SO unpleasant and said something really mean and malicious to me that had my mind reeling the entire time I was eating.(and I heard her give another employee a really demeaning comment when that girl was just trying to help). 

Ive had bad days at work and maybe acted b*tchy, but I have never tried intentionally to make someone feel bad. 

That girl sucks!!  

Anyway, aside from this girl, I still would not recommend this location until they get a smooth rhythm.  The store is on the new side and it still always seems chaotic behind the counter, and very loud.  The walk to the O'farrell location is worth it.
author: Alyson L.

description:
The burritos are the best I ever tried. 
I went back next day because it was great. 
Very quick and friendly service.
author: Jørn R.

description: I'm really love that spot. I'm always order chicken quesadilla. Quality of food is really good. It is the new standard of fast food restaurants. And also very good price
author: Vasiliy M.

description:
The store has been open for a while now, so I figured it was probably "new store" jitters. Maybe not. 

One of the reasons I love Chipotle is that I can choose to have a vegetarian burrito/bowl when I'm in a "no meat" sort of mood (happens sometimes... it does). Out of the 15 or so times I've gone in (my office is right next store) more than HALF those visits, they do not have any fajita vegetables ready. I JUST got back from the store, and they have none in the bin, and none cooking. Two people got out of line including me because of it. I have waited MANY times for them to finish; a few times they forgot I was standing there waiting. I've been to a LOT of locations, and for some reason this one always seems like the employees are running around like chickens with their heads cut off. Hopefully that's not where the chicken they serve is actually coming from.


If you're in the mood for Mexican, I HIGHLY suggest Pasilla which is RIGHT up the street on Kearny. It's actually a more healthy option.
author: Tony A.

description:
EDIT: I made a complaint on Chipotle.com and they got back to me within a couple hours. Stars for excellent customer service (from corporate).

So bummed they screwed up my online order (the order is written right on the receipt, no room for confusion!).

I got a bowl of meat and guac and mild salsa (no beans, no medium salsa, no fajita veggies).

I don't understand how you could get so much of it wrong! And the meat was cold. Not room temp, but cold.

I'm a huge fan of Chipotle, but I will NEVER order online again.
author: Fay V.

description: Don't ever go to this place an hour before closing, spend $20+ and expect to be able to use the restroom.  They've already cleaned it and covered the floor in "chemicals" that you could slip on.  Good food, but that is terrible customer service and a ridiculous policy, especially with so few places to use the restroom downtown.
author: Alyssa M.

description:
Thanks for adding the sofritos to the menu. It's nice to have another vegan option. It was tasty enough. But it was only lukewarm. I expect burritos to be hot. The only cold ingredient was the salsa, so I wouldn't have expected it to cool down that much. Three stars. Would probably be four stars if hot.

Friendly service up until I asked to use the restroom. They wouldn't let me because the second floor was closed. Um, you're supposed to have a restroom available for customers at all times. So minus one star for that.

(Actually, what am I supposed to do if I need to use the restroom before I eat? You don't get the restroom code until you purchase - it's on the receipt, but your food is made before you purchase so what, do you take your food to the restroom and let it get cold or leave it out by its lonesome and let it get cold and possibly removed? I suppose you could tell them not to make it until after you return from the restroom but you might have to tell them what you want ahead of time so they know what to charge you and can charge you and give you the restroom code and then tell them again when you come back.  Grump.)

I guess this means not good for late night and not good if you need to use the restroom before you eat.
author: Charles B.

description:
I remember when Chipotle first opened up in S.F. I was so excited because I love Mexican food. I used to go to Chipotle almost every Friday for lunch. I noticed that when the chain first opened up, they were pretty generous with their portions. I used to always get the burrito bowl. But now, they are skimping Big time! Everytime I go there, especially the location on Sutter st., they don't pile on the food like they used to. I know the economy is going through tough times, but Come On!!! If I'm going to be spending $10.00+ on a burrito bowl, I want to be full.
And what's up with that weird s curve barrier? I think it just confuses people more.
author: Edie G.

description: Typical Chipotle chain location.  This location is a duplex, and has very comfy sittings upstairs with the view down to Sutter/Kearney intersection.  It is usually clean, but the line during lunch hours can be outrageous.  Cool staffs.
author: Chi T.

description: This Chipotle is one of the best i have been to. I go to this Chipotle at least once a week for the past year or so and they have been nothing but friendly and helpful. The guy that initially cooks the tortilla is there every time i go in always talks to me and asks me how I'm doing and how business is. Sure there is always the occasional long line but they are super quick and friendly. Today i went in and i don't know if they do this randomly, but written on the foil was comp, wondering what that meant i got to the register they told me my burrito was on them. Not only are they the friendliest Chipotle but a free burrito was a very nice surprise and i will continue to go to this location! Love You Guys!
author: Zach W.

description:
I went here twice on a recent trip to SF. We were a party of 4 with a small child and this was a perfect choice. You get a great deal of flexibility since you watch each meal being made. Also they have the bottomless drinks if you dine in. The staff were friendly and the food is top stuff for fast food. The kid was happy which is a big plus in these situations. 

On my second visit I was by myself and  coming down with a cold. I did not want to try to figure out anything more complicated than a burrito at a place I knew was decent. My expectations were met and I wanted to give a shout out to this place since not all locations are the same- the people do make a difference.
author: Lesley P.

description: This place is one of the worst Chipotle locations in terms of customer service. The workers here are arrogant. I usually ask for extra cheese on my tacos. The typical response are eyes rolled at me while the server adds a small pinch of cheese. When I ask for a little more, I am met with a sigh and sometimes another pinch of cheese. This happens with such regularity that I often get nervous and dread having to ask for extras on my food when coming to this location. Listen up workers, why do you care how much cheese I want in MY tacos??  Does it cost you money to put more? No. Does it create any significant added work for you?? No. Does it impede the already snail pace of the customer line?  No. I'm the paying customer so if I'd like more cheese or beans or whatever in my food, unless there is a rule against it, you should oblige.
author: Aaron N.

description: Decent service, fresh salads. But if you have to use the restroom, don't throw your recipe away. There's a code for the upstairs potty on your recipe. Ha!
author: Tee W.

description: This Chipotle is great, often busy due to being in the middle of the FiDi district I can usually pop in a large line and get in and out in 6 min. The staff is really cool and super sweet especially for being slammed. It's always clean and the food is great. I read some of the other reviews and was really thrown off. I work near by and eat here a lot and I don't have any complaints. Grateful to have this place located close.
author: Michelle D.

description: I'm pretty sure they hire former (or current) screw-ups here (aka druggies, former inmates, thieves, etc). Now I think it's noble of chipotle to make those kinds of efforts but the problem with that is the employees here (including the manager) have no idea how to run a business. They screw up your order consistently, don't know the meaning of customer service and it's probably the DIRTIEST Chipotle in the Bay Area (check out that 2nd floor). There are a few other Chipotles in and around he FiDi area. Trust me and skip this one.
author: JungHyun H.

description:
So far the best Chipotle compared to other three locations in downtown area. 
Huge portions, friendly staff & lots of places to sit!
author: Hana K.

description: Interesting S-shape configuration. But, it's Chipotle. And it gets the job done for a tasty lunch.
author: Mel G.

description: Was not very flavorful, the chips were a bit stale and some were not crispy but soft and chewy...
author: Harold W.

description:
The food is nice, like at any Chipotle. 
Definitely my type of food, when not eating Russian food.
Depending on the time/day you come, the staff might be just ok, or great.
The lady at the cashier has more energy than any people that I know! And she is very nice!
author: Oleg K.

description: Normally Chipotle has really salty meat and sometimes scrimps on ingredients. Not the case at this location. I had to do some service work here and decided to get a chicken burrito when I was done. Meat was just right and a nice portion of fillings. The manager Chris is a sharp dude who runs a tight ship. Keep up the good work guys.
author: Hakim A.

description: An otherwise normal Chipotle with a fantastic upstairs. The wraparound bar seating and big windows make for great people watching at lunchtime. It's also a halfway decent place to get some work done if you're sick of all the hectic and claustrophobic Starbucks nearby.
author: Nick S.

description:
I don't know why anyone would go to any Chipotle (especially during the lunch rush) if they value their ears and vocal chords.  Almost every Chipotle has this problem, but this one is particularly bad.  

Customers are required to bark their orders across a very tall glass shield that rises above most customers heads.  That's hardly the biggest issue though.  The combination of grilles frying huge amounts of meat and exhaust hoods bellowing n extremely close proximity to the order line, at least a dozen customers and order takers yelling at each other to complete orders, cooks yelling at each other to communicate, and stores with zero sound-absorbing finishes makes it almost impossible for the order takers to hear what the customers are ordering.  I literally had to repeat what kind of rice I wanted THREE times, and the last time I had to scream at the top of my lungs to be heard!! Not 15 seconds later I had to be asked TWICE what kind of meat I wanted, and again I'm yelling at the top of my lungs just to get lunch.  Not my idea of a relaxing break from work, which lunch should be.  

The acoustical issues are not limited to the serving/ordering area.  Because the store is constructed of hard wood, glass, and stainless steel, with literally no sound absorbing materials, the dining areas are also extremely noisy during lunch hour, which is hardly conducive to conversation.  I was part of a group who took a new employee out to lunch on his first day, and we were yelling at each other like we were in a late night dance club.  

Did it ever occur to Chipotle to hire an acoustical consultant when they designed their stores?  I love their food, but I plan to continue avoiding Chipotle.  When I need a burrito fix there is a 360 Degrees Burrito restaurant very close to the office where I can have lunch without punishing my ears or having to strain my vocal chords.
author: Eugene B.

description: This location is always short-dicking me on the meat.   Seriously, my burrito today was almost enitrely rice.  You will lose my business if this does not get fixed.
author: Tony T.

description: I've come during lunch time and they are very fast. Amazingly fast. Everybody already knows if they like Chipotle or not, but I just want to let you know that even if the line looks really long, you can get through it and still have time to eat your lunch.
author: Gee H.

description: This location is regularly stingy with the meat. Today was the last time they charge me $7 bucks for two tablespoons of barbacoa. This seems to be a company wide policy but I will try getting my chipotle fix from the 525 Market St location.
author: Kentaro F.

description: I haven't written a YELP review in 3 years. However, this chipotle is not good. The portions are smaller and not what I expect. WACK
