author: Amul A.

description: The cash register lady needs to calm down and not yell at me. I'm here paying for a burrito bowl and she yells, "FAJITA CHICKEN BOWLLLLLLLLLLL!!!" then continues to SCREAM,"OUT OF VISAAAAAAAAAAA." People go to an establishment like this because they know what kind of service and quality they will receive.... Calm down, take my money, give me my fajita chicken bowl and let me go along my merry way please, THANK YOU!
author: Zach K.

description:
I'm normally not the type of person to write a review, as I have to moderate restaurant reviews on another website.  When I do write a review, it's because the restaurant has either spectacularly impressed me, or they have failed in some manner, which I feel needs to be addressed.  This is the latter kind of review.
Normally, this Chipotle location is my go-to spot for lunch on Sundays, because there's not a lot of stuff within walking distance of my office that is open on Sundays.  Normally, their service is adequate, and the food is, quite frankly, above average most of the time.  If this review were about any of my other visits, It would be a three-star, bordering on four-star, review.  But it isn't.  This is about my visit today.
I'm unsure what was going on today.  I ordered the same thing that I order every Sunday, because I know this locations strengths: A steak bowl with white rice, black beans, mild and corn salsas, sour cream, and cheese.  To start, they were out of white rice.  Not a big problem, as they had some on the way, and my wait time for the white rice was less than a minute.  However, the prep kitchen should have had it out there for the folks working the line.  The young lady working that part of the line was extremely sweet and apologetic, so kudos to her.  The young gent working the next part of the line was less so, unfortunately.  I'd go so far as to say he was put out when I didn't want to substitute their brown rice for white, even though I offered to step back so that they could help other guests while I waited on the rice.  Once the rice was in my bowl, he seemed even further put out that I wanted corn AND mild salsa.  This young man has helped me on numerous occasions before, and it has never been a problem before.  To end my visit, the same gent left my bowl in a position that was not readily accessible to either the cashier or myself.  Yes, I suppose the cashier could have moved a foot to the right to slide my bowl over to me.  Just like I could have reached all the way back into their prep area to grab my bowl (which I ended up doing, despite needing a cane to walk, and pretty much stand).
The food, was pretty good though.
author: Jerod K.

description:
Steve oh Steve.. (and I mean Steve Ells not Steve Jobs just to avoid any confusion here)..you had such a great idea: Mexican food in a Natural, all organic, fast, convenient, clean and friendly environment...wait..scrap that last part out. 

I just had my Chi PUCK Le experience which I can tell you as nothing organic about.

Let me start off that the food itself isn't bad at all- Not saying you are getting straight up holy shit good freaking amazing Mexican Food, but it ain't that bad either. Given the fact that we are talking about a Chain I actually applaud Steve for doing such a great job in terms of food quality. (YES, I applaud him...go to Jack in the Box and you will understand why..)
Anyway, My problem is with level of customer service which is quite honestly just one big joke. I caught myself really thinking " where is that freaking hidden camera that will come out and tell me I am on national television doing a story on people's behavior during bad Customer Service"- up until now that camera never showed. Instead I find myself in line with about 100 other people that are all there for than Mexican fix. The counter s pretty big and believe it or not, they actually have quite a few employees working behind it. Looks like a fast, effective way..stress on "LOOKS LIKE". I am amazed that no matter the number of employees, the line of customers seems to go soooo slow. Anyway, when you finally reach the counter you are faced with hurdle number 1: SHOUT your order to the lady or gentleman on the other side of the glass- Yes, SHOUT because the acoustics in this place are horrible- Great design that was probably done by a deaf architect...im just saying....
-' One vegetarian Burito please"
- "One burrito?"
-"Yes, ONE VEGETARIAN Burito Please..."
- "Would you like chicken or beef?"
- "Hmmm..it is Vegetarian..."
- "Oh OK, so One vegetarian Burito?"
- "YES please..."
- "Would you like veggies?
- "Hmm..YES, again it is a vegetarian Burito..right?"
- "Black or Pinto beans?"
- "Whats in the beans?"
- "The Pinto beans have bacon in it"
- "Oh then Ill have the black beans"
- "so the pinto beans?"
- " Uh no..the black beans please"
- "what else?"
- "well...all the veggies I would assume?"
- would you like chips? 
- "no thank you"
- "Chips and soda? "
-" uh...no thank you..no chips and no soda"

Okay I admit, I do know why it takes forever to get through that line because apparantly the employees there seem to be unable to take your order the first time around and repeat every question at least once, but more likely twice! 

So 10 minutes later I got my Burito wrapped up in front of me and I get to the paying part- This particular lady yells really hard my order" ONE VEGETARIAN BURITOOOOO YAY! Anything ELSE? " " mm...no.....thank you"

"WELL THAT WILL BE $8.57- I hand over my creditcard..and she then yells " out of VISAAAAAA"....okay slow down miss...I know it is a visa card and there is no need to scream that all the freaking place...I just lost my hearing..and quite honestly you just scare me a bit....
"THANK YOU and have a WONDERFUL DAY!!! YAAAAAY!"
"hmm...yeah..thanks..i guess..."

so there I am: 15 minutes later- 8 bucks lighter and in need of some hearing aid- but hey I have my Vegggie Burito, with all the veggies and no meat !

Chipotle: It would be great if you could train your employees at this current location a bit better and do something about that acoustic problem you have in there...if you dont know what I mean, then go in around 1 and try to place an order and try to keep your hearing when paying for your order..and no ear muffs are not allowed during this process.

I will be going to the other location on Market street from now on, it is worth the 10 minute walk and I would recommend you do the same.
author: Achraf S.

description: This has to be the worst Chipotle of all time. The manger could not be more unfriendly and the staff reflects the poor management. Simple requests are almost always denied and the portions look to be made for small children. Steer clear of this location
author: C T.

description:
I really love Chipotle! i go and eat chicken bowl twice a week.
The location is very good. So it's very crowded in lunch time, but servers were very speedy and professional and I don't usually wait so long :)
author: Mai I.

description:
I only recently tried Chipotle and love the burritos to I'm a big fan.  This location needs to do something about the noise level and inability to communicate with the servers.  

They are fast - very good when the line is a mile long.  But it also means (combined with the noise) that they can't handle a request out of the ordinary.  A few too many times I've bitten into my burrito only to have all the juice from the beans spill out onto my shirt or dress. Not great when you have 6 hours left on the clock.  So I ask them to drain the beans.  If they hear me, I'm good to go.  If they don't, it totally screws up their process because the next guy is waiting for my meat order and I can't get out fast enough that I don't want meat because  I'm going back and forth over the glass trying to tell them to drain the beans.  Now all hell is breaking loose because meat guy is just trying to do his job by spooning steak onto my vegetarian burrito.  Not sure how to solve this problem but I'm guessing I'm not the only one with some variation of this issue.
author: Deborah G.

description: Worse chipotle ever. 6 of us ended up with food poisoning since Thursday lunch. It was recycled old salsa (or whatever they did to the salsa). They had no veggies so should have been a sign that prep was missed and believe they recycled salsa (the mild salsa). Still very sick and pretty mad. Thanks chipotle! NOT. Disgusted.
author: Gigi G.

description: They give the smallest portions on bowls, don't know about the burritos. But jesus, I had to ask more of everything just to get normal portions and they still shorted me on chicken. I'm still hungry and utterly disappointed after finishing my bowl here. I won't ever come back. The girl running the register was extremely friendly, thats their only redeeming quality. The manager was sitting there doing what looked like portion control on everything. Reminded me why I never come here.
author: Michael M.

description: Meh... Chipotle is chipotle, I don't think you can expect too much and it's always going to taste the same. I'm just not okay with the people who work here. Don't get me wrong, they're very friendly and smiling all the time, but you end up having to repeat your order like ten times before they get it right. Additionally, if I'm going to pay 8 bucks for a burrito, it best have a lot of chicken in it. This chipotle seems to skimp on the meat, which bothers me, for the most part I just want the protein and that's what I'm paying for. They also don't have the tofu filling which  some other branches have started to offer. Try not to go here during peak lunch hours, the line goes out the door. Overall, I prefer the other branch on Market, but this one is convenient if you work around Kearny.
author: Neha H.

description: This chipotle has a quality control problem.  Steak was so chewy and overcooked my jaws hurt after eating it.
author: Amit P.

description: I go to this Chipotle at least once a week. Usually I can overlook the lackluster service because of the awesome food! Things have definitely gone downhill since my last review. Apparently I'm not the only one that thinks that the meat portions are skimpy because the three people in front of me all asked for a little more meat. The response they got was two more cubes/pieces of meat and a snarky "any more meat and you'll get charged for double meats." Okay, I get it, you have portions... but when I checkout and see that the ENTIRE upstairs is closed (including the bathroom) to customers, I've had it. Sure, I get it if you want to clean up there 10-15 minutes before close... but this was AN HOUR AND A HALF before your closing time. At one point I counted TEN customers standing or sitting on the weird S-shaped bench because there was not enough seating. If you don't care if I have a place to sit and eat the food I paid for, I don't need to be back. Goodbye Chipotle Tuesdays.
author: Kristina B.

description: I'm usually a sucker for any "free" deal. So, when Zipcar treated a free meal via two-for-one, how could I resist? I rarely eat a big fast food chains (Chipotle counts, right?), so I made an exception to get my two bowls: barbacoa, which was pretty good, and carne asada, which wasn't as good. Brown rice on both, no cheese or sour cream. Guacamole on both, of course.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
My first experience with Chipotle was when I was at Berkeley.  I was their loyal customer before Gordo's came in but I digress....

This is the second Chipotle I've ever been to in SF (first one was on O'Farrell) and I have to admit.. I was pretty disappointed :(

The line was crazy, but that's no biggie.  Luckily for me, I ordered online so I just walked up to the counter and asked for my order.  I was actually early but despite that, the server hurriedly apologized and rushed to make my order.  That definitely put a smile on my face :D  Since I've been to Chipotle before, I figured that the burritos would be nice and hot, even if I waited a 5 or 6 minutes to eat them (I kept them in the bag, and I had to wait since I was going to meet up my girlfriend two blocks away).

When we unwrapped our burritos.. the first thing we noticed was the absence of warmth.  The burritos did not feel like they were just made.  The next thing we noticed was how strangely the burritos were wrapped.  They weren't covered all the way.  About 1/5 of the burritos were exposed, but they were kept in the bag so we thought nothing of it.  Then we bit into the burritos and confirmed that the burritos were indeed, pretty cold.  They tasted like the burritos had been left out on a table overnight.  This was REALLY weird, because I literally picked them up less than 10 minutes ago, when they were supposed to be warm.  Even at Berkeley, if I bought a burrito at Chipotle and walked the 5 or 6 blocks home in a cold evening, the burriots would still be warm/ hot-ish by the time I ate.  This was really crazy.

I don't know how this could happen, especially when the burritos were made right when I arrived, with extremely prompt service.  It pains me to give this Chipotle a 2 star.  The lack of warmth in the burritos made it hard to eat, and even though everything was in the burrito correctly, I have to dock two stars for this not-so-enjoyable meal.  The third star docked was because of the sloppy wrapping, but I definitely recommend this Chipotle for their prompt online pickup service if anything!
author: Filmer Y.

description: Hey if you're craving an expensive burrito with lime rice and you want to pay for your chips, guacamole, and tortilla then this is the place to go! Ok,ok for me I like the lime infused rice overall it's a good burrito if you're craving one and you're not in the Mission.
author: Karen T.

description:
Gringo Burritos

I don't know how they can call this a "Mexican" grill; I saw not a single soul who could even mistakenly be identified as Mexican. But my own biases aside (that only Mexicans can make good Mexican food, and only Italians know how to cook pasta, or that a Chinese restaurant can't possibly be any good if there's no Chinese customer in sight), I ordered four (4) burritos.  Much to my regret, I had to toss two (2). The steak burrito I ordered was absolutely full of gristle. After four attempts to chew the morsels of meat, I spit out the fourth one and tossed the entire $10 concoction in the compost bin. The carnitas were tasty to me, but not to my ten-year old, who didn't appreciate the preponderance of black pepper. The best one was definitely the chicken. I should be used to the lack of refried beans, after trying to order gringo burritos at Whole Foods, but I was tricked by the mention of "Mexican" in the eatery's name. I soldiered on but had to ask twice for them to add more cheese -- slender shreds, scarcely visible, and as it turns out, entirely indeterminable. When my daughter and I arrived, there were no other customers, but it was still hard to hear the counter-persons. When I realized that the cheese would be imperceptible, I asked for guacamole to be added, to add flavor and reduce dryness. I evidently mis-heard because I thought they told me there would be a $1 charge per burrito, but it was $2/burrito, thereby making these burritos the MOST EXPENSIVE burritos I have ever had (and I've had Whole Foods', thank you very much). $10/burrito would have been fine if I'd been able to taste the cheese, or if there were more than a teensy dollop of guacamole, or if (as in the case of my steak burrito last night), there had been edible meat instead of gristle, but I was left feeling robbed. After spending over $40 for 4 burritos, I should at least be able to eat them.  Part of that cost is my fault -- I could have abstained from guacamole or ordered kids' burritos for the kids, but the beans were too dry, the cheese was imperceptible, and the steak was gristle. So I felt ripped-off. (As I said, I couldn't hear the servers, but they seemed friendly and couteous. Even my 10-year old said the cashier was "sweet"). 

I do have to say that the rice, from which I usually abstain, was the best part of the burrito. It's lime-cilantro flavored and comes in brown or white. This was my first time at any of the teeming Chipotles, and it will probably be my last. But if ever this bad memory fades and I find myself in another Chipotle, I'd order what my 3-year old calls "Chicken Rice"-- a bowl of rice with grilled chicken.  (Good call, Paloma!).
author: Lucia M.

description: Every time I go here it isn't crowded. The staff is decent, not friendly, but not rude. I found that my steak was lacking your typical chipotle seasoning last week, but other than that not a bad location.
author: Adriana B.

description: I got catering (the Big Spread) for 20 people for my birthday on a Saturday and cant say enough good things about this place. The food quality, service and everything was perfect. Chris (the manager) was awesome and really dedicated to his clients. I never write a review in Yelp but I thought this one was really worth it. Thanks so much 211 Sutter St Chipotle !
author: P T.

description: the new tofu option called sofritas is made with hodo soy and is delicious!!!  very nice.
author: Wakako U.

description: people sure hype chipotle a lot, but i'd never tried it. i tried to have an open mind going in, but i just didn't like it that much. it was pretty bland and it's disappointing that the pinto beans have bacon in them. just kind of...meh, if you have other mexican options.
author: Kate W.

description: Really Chipotle?  Every other Chipotle has given me extra beans instead of rice except you. Seriously downhill from your early days. Never going to this one again. They've become huge cheapskates.
author: Jimmy B.

description: food tasted bad and no soda machines not working... dirty store.
author: Rybone X.

description: Went to this Chipotle location today around 3pm.  It was real quick and convenient as Chipotle usually is.  I had a chicken burrito... so good!  However, I have to say minus one star for charging $2 (!!) for guacamole. That's crazy! Anyhow. A good location all in all.
author: Charles C.

description: I go this place almost every day I work, its funny there is one girl there who works the register who is tall and FULL one energy. I mean I go there because Chipotle is the only place within walking that is always consistent in terms of food quality. The place is also very new and pretty fast. I gotta give it to this spot the  people there are pretty quick. I do wish however that when you order a steak burrito that you get more than a tiny spoon full and that guacamole costs and extra 2.50 for a teaspoon amount.  I know the economy is rough but come on that has to cost almost nothing. The only other reason I do not give this place a four out of five is because the place could be kept a little cleaner in terms of when you walk in the line layout is this wavy or almost confusing guiding path to the counter. I would rather have tables there because sitting in the window to eat your meal is a little strange when people walking by are easily five feet higher than you and just stare at you. Its kind of funny to shoot a face back at them but for the most part just wish we the consumer was positioned to not be stared at. All in all the place is good. If you get the chance and are a restaurant owner and want HIGHLY energetic hostess or server you should hire this girl. FULL of energy and tall so she could have a good eye over a restaurant layout.
author: Tahoe B.
